steps.title: Fix your mind on the goal.
steps.content: Fix your mind on the goal. Before you begin, it is important to tell yourself that once you go in, you will not back out. Set the amount of time you are going to keep up working out. Some claim they want to do it for life, but give up after a certain amount of time. Make it a goal to keep up with your program for at least four months.

steps.title: Consume more water.
steps.content: Consume more water. Water is more important than food and has always been. Your body can go three to four weeks without food, but your body can barely last several days without water. Drink at least three to four water bottles a day, two at the very least. Drink two more bottles every time you workout.

steps.title: Eat at least three meals a day.
steps.content: Eat at least three meals a day. There are fitness rumors that you should consume smaller, more frequent meals, but for many, this isn't feasible. Many people are caught up with business or parenting, and do not have the amount of time to incorporate those extra meals. If that's the case, eat regular meals; calculate your calorie intake when you consume food or eat until you are full. You do not need to diet, but you should consume junk food moderately. You can eat it for three meals a week. Definitely, eat more fruits and veggies!

steps.title: Stretch.
steps.content: Stretch. You can do simple stretches, bending only until you feel pain. Do not go any further than that; hold it there for twenty seconds. Stretch every part of your body. Do this when you first wake up and at night. Stretching helps you to avoid stiffness and does improve posture somewhat.

steps.title: Pump some iron.
steps.content: Pump some iron. Buy some dumbbells from your store or gym. Keep it very light-weight, preferably 5-15 pounds. Do body-weight exercises with the weights; work different muscle groups separate days. Squats, lunges, standing calf-raises, sit-ups, push-ups, and pull-ups. Consider doing weighted calisthenics with a back-pack. [1] X Research source Reader Poll: We asked 165 wikiHow readers and 62% of them agreed that the best exercise for defining your muscles is doing squats with added weight . [Take Poll]

steps.title: Build up your reps slowly.
steps.content: Build up your reps slowly. You should start off with 6-12 reps the first week. Keep the same amount of weight you use the first week for the second week, but add 5 reps for each set you do, and then increase the weight by five pounds the next week. This builds muscular endurance and strength. Keep this cycle consistent and you are bound to get stronger doing only the same exercises. [2] X Trustworthy Source Harvard Medical School Harvard Medical School's Educational Site for the Public Go to source The baseline for weight training is at least a minimum of three days a week if you want to be healthy or ripped.

steps.title: Do some cardio.
steps.content: Do some cardio. For cardio, you don't need to do running; you can do things like rock-climbing, martial arts, and swimming. If in doubt, try four sets of sprints until you exhaust yourself, or do things like jumping rope, jumping jacks, or dance. [3] X Research source You should do at least 115 minutes of moderate intensity cardio training. If you're also trying to lose weight, try doing 300 minutes weekly.

steps.title: Give yourself time to recover.
steps.content: Give yourself time to recover. After working each muscle group, you will need at least 2 days of rest. Expect yourself to get sore. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Diet, if you need to lose weight.
steps.content: Diet, if you need to lose weight. With a good plan, you can do this safely, without sacrificing the nutrition your body needs. There are several diets you can try, like Paleo. Eat more fruits or vegetables.

steps.title: Fast, smartly.
steps.content: Fast, smartly. For every one to two days of the week, replace your meals with only smoothies. Add as many fruits or ingredients you would like. 3-4 smoothies is the recommendation.

steps.title: Do workouts with high repetitions.
steps.content: Do workouts with high repetitions. If you use weights, make sure they are very light, and continue to do reps until you are tired.

steps.title: Do cardio.
steps.content: Do cardio. Swimming or high-intensity aerobic exercises. You can run for as long as you want or as fast as you want. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Do not eat junk food.
steps.content: Do not eat junk food. Cut it out, completely , until you reach your goal. When you're at your goal weight, consume it in moderation. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Eat at least three meals a day.
steps.content: Eat at least three meals a day. Yes, you can gain weight on only three meals a day, but only if you consume enough calories within those meals.

steps.title: Try supplements to help you gain muscle.
steps.content: Try supplements to help you gain muscle. Buy Whey Protein, Creatine, or make your own. [7] X Trustworthy Source Harvard Medical School Harvard Medical School's Educational Site for the Public Go to source

steps.title: Start off light with your reps and make it heavier every week.
steps.content: Start off light with your reps and make it heavier every week. [8] X Trustworthy Source Harvard Medical School Harvard Medical School's Educational Site for the Public Go to source

steps.title: Don't neglect rest.
steps.content: Don't neglect rest. Resting allows your muscles to develop. Try drinking some sleep herbal teas that shall allow you to rest at night.

steps.title: Disregard junk food.
steps.content: Disregard junk food. Junk food can put on weight or bulk you up rather fast, but after 40, it is very unhealthy to the body. So, if you are not suffering from weight loss issues, then you can eat junk food more often. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Do cardio very rarely.
steps.content: Do cardio very rarely. Sprint instead of jogging. Cardio prevents your ability to put on weight. Therefore, do not do it as much. [10] X Research source
